DOC.brief_summary: This study investigator compare peak airway pressure ( PAP ) , expire tidal volume ( TV ) , end tidal CO2 ( ETCO2 ) , SpO2 , mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) heart rate ( HR ) insertion laryngeal tube suction endotracheal tube patient undergo elective gynecological laparoscopic surgery .
DOC.brief_title: The Laryngeal Tube Suction Versus Endotracheal Tube Ventilation Gynecological Laparoscopic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Background : For standard procedure , endotracheal tube use ventilate anesthetized patient undergo gynecological laparoscopic surgery increase intrabdominal pressure . Now new supraglottic airway device , laryngeal tube suction ( LTs ) use instead ETT . Objective This study investigator compare peak airway pressure ( PAP ) , expire tidal volume ( TV ) , end tidal CO2 ( ETCO2 ) , SpO2 , mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) heart rate ( HR ) insertion laryngeal tube suction endotracheal tube patient undergo elective gynecological laparoscopic surgery . Material method Prospective single blind randomize control trial , patient divide two group , LTs group ETT group n = 60 group . All patient induce anesthesia fentanyl 1-2 mcg/kg , propofol 2 mg/kg , vecuronium 0.1 mg/kg maintain anesthesia air : oxygen 30 % . Respirator set tidal volume 10 ml/kg , I/E 1:2 adjust RR base ETCO2 keep ETCO2 35-40 mmHg . Results No statistical difference demographic data group . PAP ETCO2 LTs group significant high ETT group first 5 10 minute statistically significant 10 minute end operation . No statistically significant TV SpO2 group . In ETT group MAP HR insertion significant high LTs group , statistically significant postoperative complication sorethroat , hoarseness nausea vomit . Conclusion LTs use gynecological laparoscopic surgery like ETT .
DOC.criteria: female age 2065 year ASA class 12 elective gynecologic laparoscopic surgery height < 180 cm BMI < 35 kg/m2 interincisor gap < 2.5 cm risk aspiration history difficult intubation oropharyngeal pathology allergy anesthetic drug
